definition: Bismarck (name)/Otto von Bismarck (1815-1898), Prussian politician, Minister-President of Prussia 1862-1873, Chancellor of Germany 1871-1890
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: Bismarck was enormously powerful in his 26 years as Prussia's political leader.
sentences.chinese: 在擔任普魯士政治領袖的26年間，俾斯麥位高權重。

sentences.english: The military situation was clearly not disturbing him, and Bismarck was enormously reassured.
sentences.chinese: 戰情顯然沒有令他不安，俾斯麥大感放心了。

sentences.english: This system has elements of both Beveridge and Bismarck.
sentences.chinese: 這個制度的內容具有貝弗裏奇和俾斯麥模式的成份。

sentences.english: Bismarck was enormously powerful in his 26 years as Prussia’s political leader.
sentences.chinese: 在擔任普魯士政治領袖的26年間，俾斯麥位高權重。

sentences.english: Bismarch ruled Germany by a strong hand.
sentences.chinese: 俾斯麥用高壓手段統治德國。

sentences.english: Bismarck ruled Germany by a strong hand.
sentences.chinese: 俾斯麥用鐵腕手段統治德國。

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: to postpone one's graduation (e.g. by undertaking additional studies) (abbr. for 延後畢業|延后毕业[yan2 hou4 bi4 ye4])
number in a sequence/ordinal number/serial number
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
